CONSENT_Q:
1. Study Title: Risk Perception of Workplace Behaviors

2. Purpose of the Study and Study Procedures: The purpose of this project is to understand how constructive deviance work behaviors are perceived. This study consists of an online questionnaire that will take approximately 8 minutes to complete. The survey will include demographic items and questions regarding the perceived risk of different behaviors. 
 
3. Risks: Risks associated with this study are low and no more than risks that would be encountered in one’s daily activities. The nature of the questions is non-invasive. The act of answering questions via the online survey is no riskier than other computer-based online activities. 

4. Benefits: You may benefit from participating in this study by contributing to scientific research and by gaining increased insight into your thoughts about workplace behaviors. 
 


5. Investigators: Katelyn May Reeves (Ph.D. student) may be reached at kreev16@lsu.edu. Dr. Don Zhang (Louisiana State University) may be reached at zhang1@lsu.edu. The investigators may be reached 8:00 AM-5:00 PM M-F (CST). 

6. Performance Site: The study will be conducted online, however, both investigators will be involved with the research process from their respective locations. 

7. Number of subjects: 200 

8. Subject Inclusion: Participants must be 18 years old or older and work 30+ hours per week.

9. Subject Exclusion: Participants will be excluded if they are younger than 18 years old or work less than 30 hours per week.

10. Privacy: All data will be kept confidential unless release is legally compelled. The information will be stored in an encrypted and/or password protected file. As this study is being conducted through (Prolific), there will be no identifying information collected at any point. 

11. Financial Information: Upon completion of the survey, participants will be compensated $1.00. Payment will be distributed to participants through Prolific. 

12. Right to Refuse: Participants may choose not to participate or to withdraw at any time without penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled. If a participant chooses to withdraw, they will lose the opportunity for compensation and should notify the investigators via email. 

13. Consent: I agree that the study has been discussed with me and all my questions have been answered. I may direct any additional questions regarding study specifics to the investigators. For injury or illness, call your physician. If I have questions about the subject's rights or other concerns, I can contact Alex Cohen, Chairman, LSU Institutional Review Board, (225) 578-8692, irb@lsu.edu, or www.lsu.edu/research. I agree to participate in the study described above.  
 
We are requesting a waiver of signed consent. Please indicate if you do or do not agree to consent.
AGE: What is your current age in years?
HPW: On average, how many hours do you work per week at your primary job?
RACE: Please indicate your race. Select all that apply - Selected Choice
RACE_6_TEXT: Please indicate your race. Select all that apply - f. Some other race, ethnicity, or origin (fill in blank) - Text
GENDER: How do you identify? - Selected Choice
GENDER_4_TEXT: How do you identify? - Other: I self-identify as... (please specify) - Text
EDU: What is the highest level of education that you've completed?
TENURE: How many years have you been working for your current employer?
JOB_TITLE: What is your current job title?
MANAGER: Do you hold a managerial position in your current job?
NUM_EMPLOYEES: How many employees work in your organization?
INDUSTRY: Which of the following industries most closely matches the one in which you are employed?
GRQ: How willing are you to take risks in the workplace?
RMP: Risk management is the process of identifying, assessing, monitoring, controlling or mitigating and reporting to senior management on risk exposures. Does your organization have a risk management policy?
POWER_1:
Think of the ladder as showing where people stand in your current organization with respect to having power, which is defined as the ability to influence others. At the top of the ladder are people with the most power, and at the bottom are people with the least power.



 

Think about your current organization and please answer the following questions: - Where would you currently place yourself on this ladder?

Think of the ladder as showing where people stand in your current organization with respect to having power, which is defined as the ability to influence others. At the top of the ladder are people with the most power, and at the bottom are people with the least power.

COMPETE: I thought of competition with others at work as a way to enhance my development and to demonstrate my self-worth.
COOP: I viewed others at work as partners wherein I was willing to work with them to achieve common goals.
NORM_COMMIT: I felt like I stayed with my organization mainly because I felt that I "ought to."
INNOVATE: My organization places a lot of emphasis on encouraging and supporting new ideas and innovative approaches.
